query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Imagini, chi bene intender cupe 2 quel ch’i’ or vidi—e ritegna l’image, 3 mentre ch’io dico, come ferma rupe—,
query.error: **English:** 1 Imagine, if you can fully understand 2 what I saw then—and hold the image fast 3 as I speak, like a solid rock—,
query.result: 1 Kalpayatu yaḥ śobhanena vijānāti 2 yat tadā mayā dṛṣṭam—dhārayatu ca mūrtiṃ, 3 yathāhaṃ bruve, yathā dhruvā śilā—,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 quindici stelle che ’n diverse plage 5 lo ciel avvivan di tanto sereno 6 che soperchia de l’aere ogne compage;
query.error: **English:** 4 fifteen stars that in different regions 5 enliven the sky with such serenity 6 that they surpass every part of the air;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 imagini quel carro a cu’ il seno 8 basta del nostro cielo e notte e giorno, 9 sì ch’al volger del temo non vien meno;
query.error: **English:** 7 imagine the chariot whose axle 8 spans our sky both night and day, 9 so that it does not wane as the pole turns;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 imagini la bocca di quel corno 11 che si comincia in punta de lo stelo 12 a cui la prima rota va dintorno,
query.error: **English:** 10 imagine the mouth of that horn 11 that begins at the tip of the axis 12 around which the first wheel revolves,
query.result: 10 kalpayatu mukham tasya śṛṅgasya 11 yat pravartate agra-deśe akṣasya 12 yasya paritaḥ prathamaṃ cakram vartate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 aver fatto di sé due segni in cielo, 14 qual fece la figliuola di Minoi 15 allora che sentì di morte il gelo;
query.error: **English:** 13 having made two signs of itself in the sky, 14 like the daughter of Minos did 15 when she felt the chill of death;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 e l’un ne l’altro aver li raggi suoi, 17 e amendue girarsi per maniera 18 che l’uno andasse al primo e l’altro al poi;
query.error: **English:** 16 and the one having its rays in the other, 17 and both turning in such a way 18 that one went to the east and the other to the west;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 e avrà quasi l’ombra de la vera 20 costellazione e de la doppia danza 21 che circulava il punto dov’ io era:
query.error: **English:** 19 and you will have almost the shadow of the true 20 constellation and of the double dance 21 that circled the point where I was:
query.result: 19 ca bhaviṣyati prāyaḥ chāyā satyasya 20 nakṣatra-gaṇasya ca dvidhā-nṛtyasya ca 21 yaḥ paribhramaṇam karoti tasmin sthāne yatra aham āsam:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 poi ch’è tanto di là da nostra usanza, 23 quanto di là dal mover de la Chiana 24 si move il ciel che tutti li altri avanza.
query.error: **English:** 22 for it is as far beyond our experience 23 as the sky that surpasses all others 24 is beyond the movement of the Chiana.
query.result: 22 yataḥ tat atiriktam asti asmākam ācārāt, 23 yathā Chianāyāḥ gatauḥ parataḥ 24 vartate nabhaḥ yat sarvān anyān atiśayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Lì si cantò non Bacco, non Peana, 26 ma tre persone in divina natura, 27 e in una persona essa e l’umana.
query.error: **English:** 25 There Bacchus was not sung, nor Paean, 26 but three Persons in divine nature, 27 and in one Person this and the human.
query.result: 25 Tatrāpi na Bhakko na Paianaḥ gīyate sma, 26 Api tu trayo jīvāḥ daivīṃ prakṛtim āpannāḥ, 27 Ekaśca jīvaḥ ayam ca mānuṣaśca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Compié ’l cantare e ’l volger sua misura; 29 e attesersi a noi quei santi lumi, 30 felicitando sé di cura in cura.
query.error: **English:** 28 He completed his singing and the turning of his measure; 29 and those holy lights awaited us, 30 blessing themselves from care to care.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Ruppe il silenzio ne’ concordi numi 32 poscia la luce in che mirabil vita 33 del poverel di Dio narrata fumi,
query.error: **English:** 31 The harmonious gods broke their silence, 32 then the light in which the wondrous life 33 of the poor man of God was narrated to me,
query.result: 31 Saṁvādivṛndārakṣitāṃtuṣṇīmbhavam, 32 tataḥprakāśaḥyasminnarrationamāhatmyamāścaryam, 33 devakīnandanasya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 e disse: «Quando l’una paglia è trita, 35 quando la sua semenza è già riposta, 36 a batter l’altra dolce amor m’invita.
query.error: **English:** 34 and said: "When one straw is threshed, 35 when its seed is already stored, 36 sweet love invites me to thresh the other.
query.result: 34 uvāca ca, "ekasyaśūlasyaghṛṣṭasya, 35 tasya bījasya samāropitasya, 36 anyasyaghṛṣaṇāyamadhuraḥpremaḥmāṃprarocayati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Tu credi che nel petto onde la costa 38 si trasse per formar la bella guancia 39 il cui palato a tutto ’l mondo costa,
query.error: **English:** 37 You believe that in the breast where the rib 38 was drawn out to form the lovely cheek 39 whose palate cost the whole world so dear,
query.result: 37 Tvam manyase yatra vakṣasi yasya pārśvam 38 ākṛṣṭam āsīt sundara gaṇḍasya nirvāhaṇāya 39 yasya tāluḥ sakala jagataḥ mūlyam āsīt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 e in quel che, forato da la lancia, 41 e prima e poscia tanto sodisfece, 42 che d’ogne colpa vince la bilancia,
query.error: **English:** 40 and in that which, pierced by the lance, 41 both before and after gave such satisfaction 42 that it outweighs every sin in the balance,
query.result: 40 tathā ca yasmin śaktiḥ bhinnam āsīt 41 pūrvam ca paścāt ca yena tāvad ārādhanam kṛtam 42 yena sarva pāpabhyaḥ adhikaḥ tulāyāṃ bhavati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 quantunque a la natura umana lece 44 aver di lume, tutto fosse infuso 45 da quel valor che l’uno e l’altro fece;
query.error: **English:** 43 as much as is permitted to human nature 44 to have of light, was all infused 45 by that power which made both the one and the other;
query.result: 43 yāvad eva mānuṣī prakṛtiḥ śaknoti 44 prakāśasya adhigamanaṃ kartum, sarvam eva tat 45 tena śaktyā āsīt yena ubhau api kṛtau,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 e però miri a ciò ch’io dissi suso, 47 quando narrai che non ebbe ’l secondo 48 lo ben che ne la quinta luce è chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 46 and therefore look at what I said above, 47 when I related that the second had not 48 the good that is enclosed in the fifth light.
query.result: 46 atas ca mama uktam idam paśya yad ahaṃ pūrvam 47 ācakṣe yad dvitīyasya na āsīt 48 tat śubham yat pañcame prakāśe nihitam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Or apri li occhi a quel ch’io ti rispondo, 50 e vedräi il tuo credere e ’l mio dire 51 nel vero farsi come centro in tondo.
query.error: **English:** 49 Now open your eyes to what I am answering you, 50 and you will see your belief and my words 51 become true, like a center in a circle.
query.result: 49 Idānīm tvam me pratiprasnavākyam śṛṇu, 50 tathā ca tava viśvāsam mama ca vacanam 51 madhye varttamānam cakravat satyam bhaviṣyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Ciò che non more e ciò che può morire 53 non è se non splendor di quella idea 54 che partorisce, amando, il nostro Sire;
query.error: **English:** 52 That which does not die and that which can die 53 are nothing but the splendor of that idea 54 which our Lord begets, loving;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 ché quella viva luce che sì mea 56 dal suo lucente, che non si disuna 57 da lui né da l’amor ch’a lor s’intrea,
query.error: **English:** 55 for that living light which so streams 56 from its brightness, which is never separated 57 from it nor from the love which unites them,
query.result: 55 Yataḥ sā jīvanī jyotir yā tathā 56 Sva-prakāśāt pravartate, yā na viyujyate 57 Na tasmāt na ca premṇā yena saṁyujyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 per sua bontate il suo raggiare aduna, 59 quasi specchiato, in nove sussistenze, 60 etternalmente rimanendosi una.
query.error: **English:** 58 by its goodness gathers its radiance 59 as if reflected, into nine subsistences, 60 remaining eternally one.
query.result: 58 Sva-sauśīlyāt sva-tejas tām samāharati 59 Yathā darpaṇe, nava-tattveṣu, 60 Nityam ekāvatī sthitā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Quindi discende a l’ultime potenze 62 giù d’atto in atto, tanto divenendo, 63 che più non fa che brevi contingenze;
query.error: **English:** 61 Then it descends to the ultimate potencies, 62 down from act to act, becoming so much, 63 that it does nothing but brief contingencies;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 e queste contingenze essere intendo 65 le cose generate, che produce 66 con seme e sanza seme il ciel movendo.
query.error: **English:** 64 and these contingencies I mean to be 65 the generated things, which the heavens produce 66 with seed and without seed, as they move.
query.result: 64 ime ca vyāpārāḥ sambhāvyante 65 jāyamānāḥ padārthāḥ, yān utpādayati 66 bījena saha vā vinā vā dyulokam calanāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 La cera di costoro e chi la duce 68 non sta d’un modo; e però sotto ’l segno 69 idëale poi più e men traluce.
query.error: **English:** 67 The wax of these [stars] and what leads them 68 are not of one kind; and therefore under the 69 ideal sign one shines more and another less.
query.result: 67 Eṣām madhurasya ca yaḥ praṇayati 68 Naikaḥ prakāraḥ; atas tasya lakṣaṇe 69 Adhikaṃ vā alpam vā prakāśate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ond’ elli avvien ch’un medesimo legno, 71 secondo specie, meglio e peggio frutta; 72 e voi nascete con diverso ingegno.
query.error: **English:** 70 Hence it happens that one and the same tree, 71 according to its species, bears better and worse fruits; 72 and you are born with diverse talents.
query.result: 70 Yataḥ sambhavati yadekaṃ vṛkṣaḥ, 71 jāti-viśeṣeṇa śreṣṭha-kaniṣṭha-phalaḥ, 72 tathā yūyaṃ jāyante vividha-prakṛtayaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Se fosse a punto la cera dedutta 74 e fosse il cielo in sua virtù supprema, 75 la luce del suggel parrebbe tutta;
query.error: **English:** 73 If the wax that is dropped were at its highest point, 74 and if the heavens were at their greatest power, 75 the light of the seal would appear to be complete;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 ma la natura la dà sempre scema, 77 similemente operando a l’artista 78 ch’a l’abito de l’arte ha man che trema.
query.error: **English:** 76 but nature always gives it incompletely, 77 working in the same way as the artist 78 whose hand trembles as he works on the details of his art.
query.result: 76 api tu prakṛtiḥ sāmudrāṃ dadāti, 77 yathā kalākāraḥ api kalākāryam karoti, 78 yasya hastau kalākāryakaraṇe kampante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Però se ’l caldo amor la chiara vista 80 de la prima virtù dispone e segna, 81 tutta la perfezion quivi s’acquista.
query.error: **English:** 79 But if the warm love disposes and marks 80 the clear vision of the first virtue, 81 all perfection is acquired here.
query.result: 79 Paro yadi uṣṇaḥ premaḥ svacchaṃ darśanaṃ 80 ādyasya guṇasya karoti niyojayati ca, 81 sarvā sampūrṇatā atra prāpyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 sì ch’io commendo tua oppinïone, 86 che l’umana natura mai non fue 87 né fia qual fu in quelle due persone.
query.error: **English:** 85 so that I commend your opinion, 86 that human nature never was 87 nor will be such as it was in those two persons.
query.result: 85 yataḥ aham tava matam praśaṃsāmi, 86 yad uktam mānuṣī prakṛtir na kadācit 87 abhūt na ca bhaviṣyati yathā tad-dvaye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Or s’i’ non procedesse avanti piùe, 89 ‘Dunque, come costui fu sanza pare?’ 90 comincerebber le parole tue.
query.error: **English:** 88 Now if I did not proceed further, 89 'Then how was he without peer?' 90 your words would begin.
query.result: 88 Atha aham agre na yāsyāmi, 89 'Tatra ayam katham asamo 'bhūt?' 90 iti tava vacanaṃ pravartate sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Ma perché paia ben ciò che non pare, 92 pensa chi era, e la cagion che ’l mosse, 93 quando fu detto “Chiedi”, a dimandare.
query.error: **English:** 91 But so that what does not appear may appear well, 92 consider who he was, and the reason that moved him, 93 when it was said "Ask", to ask.
query.result: 91 Api tu yathā yat kiṃ na pratibhāti, tat prabhāti, 92 vicintayatām kena kena vā pravṛttaḥ, 93 yadā uktam "yāca", yācane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Non ho parlato sì, che tu non posse 95 ben veder ch’el fu re, che chiese senno 96 acciò che re sufficïente fosse;
query.error: **English:** 94 I have not spoken so that you cannot 95 clearly see that he was the king who asked for wisdom 96 so that he would be a sufficient king;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 non per sapere il numero in che enno 98 li motor di qua sù, o se necesse 99 con contingente mai necesse fenno;
query.error: **English:** 97 not to know the number in which are 98 the movers of the heavens, or if of necessity 99 they ever made necessary with contingent;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 non si est dare primum motum esse, 101 o se del mezzo cerchio far si puote 102 trïangol sì ch’un retto non avesse.
query.error: **English:** 100 not whether it is possible for the first motion to exist, 101 or whether it is possible to make a triangle from a semicircle 102 such that it does not have a right angle.
query.result: 100 na asti iti prathamam pravartanaṃ syāt, 101 vā yadi ardhacakratas trikonaṃ kartaṃ śakyate 102 tathā yathā tasya samkoṇaḥ na syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Onde, se ciò ch’io dissi e questo note, 104 regal prudenza è quel vedere impari 105 in che lo stral di mia intenzion percuote;
query.error: **English:** 103 Therefore, if what I said and this you note, 104 that is royal prudence, that you learn to see 105 where the arrow of my intention strikes;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 e se al “surse” drizzi li occhi chiari, 107 vedrai aver solamente respetto 108 ai regi, che son molti, e ’ buon son rari.
query.error: **English:** 106 and if you turn your clear eyes to the “arose,” 107 you will see that it refers only 108 to kings, who are many, and good ones are rare.
query.result: 106 yadi ca “surre” tava spashṭau netrāv āvartayiṣyasi, 107 paśyasi tatra kevalam ādaraṇīyatvam eva 108 rājñām, ye bahutaraḥ santi, śubhāḥ ca alpāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Con questa distinzion prendi ’l mio detto; 110 e così puote star con quel che credi 111 del primo padre e del nostro Diletto.
query.error: **English:** 109 With this distinction, take my statement; 110 and thus it can stand with what you believe 111 about the first father and our Beloved.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 E questo ti sia sempre piombo a’ piedi, 113 per farti mover lento com’ uom lasso 114 e al sì e al no che tu non vedi:
query.error: **English:** 112 And let this always be a weight upon your feet, 113 to make you move slowly like a weary man, 114 and to the yes and the no that you do not see:
query.result: 112 Etadapi tava sada pādayoḥ śilābhavatu, 113 tava gamanamandīkuruṇotu śrāntajanavat, 114 evaṃ ca tvaṃ yat satyam yat mithyā ca na jānāsi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 ché quelli è tra li stolti bene a basso, 116 che sanza distinzione afferma e nega 117 ne l’un così come ne l’altro passo;
query.error: **English:** 115 for he is among the fools, and rightly so, 116 who affirms and denies without distinction, 117 in the one case as in the other;
query.result: 115 tataḥ sa mūrkha eva, 116 yaḥ vivecanarahitam eva svīkaroti na ca svīkaroti, 117 ekena mārgeṇa anyena vā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 perch’ elli ’ncontra che più volte piega 119 l’oppinïon corrente in falsa parte, 120 e poi l’affetto l’intelletto lega.
query.error: **English:** 118 because he encounters that which often bends 119 the common opinion in the wrong direction, 120 and then the intellect binds the affection.
query.result: 118 Tataḥ sa pratipadyate yad bahuśaḥ vikurute 119 Pravṛttaṃ mithyāmatiṃ, 120 Tataś ca buddhiṃ ratiḥ badhnāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Vie più che ’ndarno da riva si parte, 122 perché non torna tal qual e’ si move, 123 chi pesca per lo vero e non ha l’arte.
query.error: **English:** 121 More often than not, one sets out from shore in vain, 122 because one who fishes for the truth without the art 123 does not return in the same state as when he set out.
query.result: 121 Adhikaṃ nirarthakaṃ tataḥ tīrāt pracayaḥ kriyate, 122 yataḥ saḥ punaḥ na yathā pravṛttaḥ āgacchati, 123 yaḥ satyārtham matsyaṃ gṛhṇāti na ca tasya kalā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 E di ciò sono al mondo aperte prove 125 Parmenide, Melisso e Brisso e molti, 126 li quali andaro e non sapëan dove;
query.error: **English:** 124 And of this there are clear proofs in the world: 125 Parmenides, Melissus, and Bryson, and many others, 126 who went and did not know where;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 sì fé Sabellio e Arrio e quelli stolti 128 che furon come spade a le Scritture 129 in render torti li diritti volti.
query.error: **English:** 127 so did Sabellius and Arius and those fools 128 who were like swords to the Scriptures, 129 in twisting the straight meanings.
query.result: 127 Tathāivam abhūt Sābēlliōsya, Āryasya ca, tathā ca mūḍhāḥ, 128 Yē śāstrēṣu asirūpēṣu kṛpāṇā iva āsann, 129 Arthān ṛjūn vikṛtya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Non sien le genti, ancor, troppo sicure 131 a giudicar, sì come quei che stima 132 le biade in campo pria che sien mature;
query.error: **English:** 130 Let people not be too sure yet 131 in judging, like those who assess 132 the crops in the field before they are ripe;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 ch’i’ ho veduto tutto ’l verno prima 134 lo prun mostrarsi rigido e feroce, 135 poscia portar la rosa in su la cima;
query.error: **English:** 133 for I have seen all winter long 134 the thornbush show itself rigid and fierce, 135 then later bear the rose on its summit;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 e legno vidi già dritto e veloce 137 correr lo mar per tutto suo cammino, 138 perire al fine a l’intrar de la foce.
query.error: **English:** 136 and I have seen wood, once straight and swift, 137 sail the sea for its entire journey, 138 only to perish at the end upon entering the harbor.
query.result: 136 tathā kāṣṭham api adṛkṣam ṛju ca vega-vat ca 137 samudram atiriktasya sarvasya mārgasya tasya, 138 vināśam āpnoti ante pravartanamātreṇa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Non creda donna Berta e ser Martino, 140 per vedere un furare, altro offerere, 141 vederli dentro al consiglio divino;
query.error: **English:** 139 Let not Lady Berta and Sir Martin believe, 140 that to see one stealing and another offering, 141 they can see them within the divine council;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 ché quel può surgere, e quel può cadere».
query.error: **English:** 142 for one can rise and the other can fall.
query.result: 142 yaḥ khalu utthātum śaknoti, saḥ khalu patitum api śaknoti.
